Name: Glass Plaque Commemorating Foundation of Serapeum
Description: The glass plaque commemorates the foundation of the Serapeum Temple in Alexandria. The inscription, in black ink, is written in five lines in Greek. The foundation of the great Serapeum at Alexandria dated to the reign of Ptolemy the Third Euergetes and his wife Berenice the Second, the two Benefactor gods, as stated in the inscription.
